topic.title: Spreading the Word
topic.body:
Greets,

Are there any recommended ways to spread the word about ZeroNet?

1_1Ey4hYTcoTAGEbZM7UuMTNr24SH4LySwrP.body:
> [planespherev3](#comment_220_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): There are directional wifi antennas which can cover dozens of kilometers. [...]

Yes. But they can tend to have a good deal of latency and packet loss associated with them. There is also the issue of building out a more robust wireless standard...

> [kaffie](#comment_396_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Other way around. It's pretty easy technically. All the tech already exists. A lot of it is used for the traditional internet. The issue is political, economical, and societal. The hard part is deploying the hardware due to regulations, restrictions, cost, etc. [...]

Whereas ISPs used to pop out of the ground like daisies when Ma Bell was the order of the day.

1_1d6oFadKcBXxEZHvmvAiZCoyrBeAmmLdi.body:
> [adamleo](#comment_1_1KXweVRjumxcCbmnitezx2uABaCHdQxTjQ): where all the gays at

Europe.
